snippet: An admirer of the man known best for killing Alexander Hamilton is showing much of his collection of Burriana at the Groiler Club starting May 16.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; lawyer Brian D Hardison's collection of artifacts related to Aaron Burr, Revolutionary War hero best known for killing Alexander Hamilton, will be on view at the Grolier Club in Manhattan; dealers and auction houses are sifting through the inventory of New York tribal-art dealer Joseph G Gerena; B&B Carousell, antique amusement ride that New York City bought for $1.8 million in 2005, is undergoing restoration.
lead_paragraph: An admirer of the man known best for killing Alexander Hamilton is showing much of his collection of Burriana at the Groiler Club starting May 16.

headline.seo: Aaron Burr Items at the Grolier Club
headline.main: Making a Case to Remember Burr
headline.print_headline: Making a Case to Remember Burr
